ExperienceSummary.ManagementStory:
Starting on 4/1/2019, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 14 months:
	Title: Lead Designer for Paciolan
Starting on 7/1/2016, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 2 years and 9 months:
	Title: Lead Designer for Cirruspath
Starting on 1/1/2013, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 4 years:
	Title: Co-Founder, Lead UX/UI Designer, and Front-End Developer for SpeakUp
Starting on 1/1/2013, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 4 years:
	Title: Co-Founder, Lead UX/UI Designer, and Front-End Developer for The Spark
Starting on 1/1/2010, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 4 years:
	Title: Sr. Art Director, Sr. UX/UI Designer for Wunderman West
Starting on 1/1/2013, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 12 months:

	Title: Jr. Art Director, UX/UI Designer for The Buddy Group

Positions.Description:
Distinction of releasing 2 major label releases with Sony/Epic Records, 4 Independent Albums and 9 Music Videos. Successfully toured
United States, Canada, United Kingdom, Ireland, Europe, Japan, Australia, and New Zealand.

Guided a team of 6 designers, including Director of Product Design. Managed operations focused on the B2B enterprise side. Developed
new design systems utilized across all applications to ensure quality transfer from design to code.

•   Implemented the UX Review Process for Development Team in Engineering to ensure that UX design quality maintained
throughout the process until production
•   Successfully spearheaded project called Seat Level Pricing to allow customers to price any seat in a stadium instantly individually
•   As an event approached, promoters price seats more accurately based on demand; helped clients made a lot more money
•   Proactively implemented UX Review Process in Jira for every development team in engineering
•   The process allowed to check-in at multiple checkpoints to ensure the product was being built as per vision from a design and code perspective
•   Key role in creating a design system which every designer on the team used for all projects
•   Deployed Amplitude Analytics So ware to helps product teams track user behavior and flows; for every feature tracked and analyzed the feature performance to tweak and improve the process as-built

Responsible for leading design projects across the entire product lifecycle, multiple product launches, se ing the vision for the user
experience, and creating the space for the team to collaborate. Spearheaded operations of a complete rebranding of the organization.
Actively involved in designing visually-engaging digital products and refreshing UX/UI of Web, iOS, and Android Apps.

•   Iteratively create and refine visual elements and manage all digital & print assets for design and marketing departments
•   Liaised with teams of project managers, designers, developers and production specialists on multiple web projects and agile
team for front-end development
•   Advised on best practices, standards, and tools in digital design and UX
•   Understood design needs of large-scale projects and broke them down into bite-sized job stories with design deliverables;
created a Design System to be used by every designer for all projects
•   Effectively communicated design concepts, received feedback, iterated and a ained client's approval; received strong positive
feedback from customers on the overall UX/UI of the products
•   Proactively implemented a workflow for using Abstract (like Github) for designs
•   Deployed Amplitude Analytics So ware to helps product teams track user behavior and flows; for every feature tracked and analyzed the feature performance to tweak and improve the process as-built
•   Implemented UX Review Process in Jira for every development team in Engineering

Findings.Message: We found no EDUCATION HISTORY section header for the candidate, but we calculated where we thought EDUCATION HISTORY was located in the resume. The education history section should have a header such as 'Education' before listing the content.
You should not use the PDF format for your resume. Due to inherent limitations with text extraction from PDFs, you are less likely to get a job when using a PDF resume.
A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.
Every degree in a resume should have a name or type associated with it, such as 'B.S.' or 'M.S.'.
High school (or lower) education should not be included on resumes that contain higher-level education.

The following section was identified as a skills section type: 'Core Competencies'. Skills should not be in a separate section, but instead, each skill should be included in the descriptions of work history or education. THIS IS INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT FOR AI MATCHING ALGORITHMS
